data.text:
@koozookit Several ministers and high-profile media commentators have effectively told us to "mask up, stay at home" if we are older or vulnerable, for the foreseeable future.
https://t.co/IDCPY3UXGd

@koozookit We have created the extended lockdowns, social isolation & financial hardship the anti-lockdown idiots spent 2 years whining about. Except locking up 1/5 of the population forever seems to be fine with them. As does the continuing high level of Covid illness & death. Lose-lose.

@koozookit With the level of vaccination we have, we could have controlled infection with limited restrictions. We have done nothing at all for environmental risk. We should not have significant numbers in hospital. It was a choice to fail so badly.

@StuartDNeilson I agree we should have come up with a multi-layered/combinatorial approach to attack/crush the virus, every intervention helps.

My parents are high risk & elderly. I'm very grateful for vaccines, may have saved them & let them approach normalcy, so not wasted(that way), IMO

@koozookit Every advance in vaccination has been undermined by allowing unrestricted spread. We could have had almost no hospitalisations, with far lower business & social disruption than 2021.
Our level of illness is a failure, and a waste of the 4 vaccines per head Ireland has hoarded.
